question: Weighing Balance Measure _______________.

Weighed and transferred 0.5g of sodium chloride into 100ml volumetric flask, dissolved and diluted up to the mark using water and mixed. Diluted 5ml of this solution to 50ml with water and mixed. Calculate the concentration of the final solution.

Weighed and transferred 0.1g of sodium chloride into 50ml volumetric flask, dissolved and diluted up to the mark using water and mixed. Diluted 4ml of this solution to 20ml with water and mixed. Calculate the concentration of the final solution.

What is the acceptance criteria of Temperature of solution under measurement as per USP?
What is the relationship of hydrogen ion concentration and pH Value.
If the hydrogen ion concentration is 10-5 mol/L, what is the pH of solution.
If the hydrogen ion concentration of solution-1 is 10-5 mol/L and  hydrogen ion concentration of solution-2 is 10-2 mol/L, choose the correct option.
options: Solution-1 is more acidic than solution-2
Solution-1 is acidic and  solution-2 is basic
Solution-2 is more basic than solution-1
Solution-2 is more acidic than solution-1

question: If the hydrogen ion concentration of solution-1 is 10-5 mol/L and  hydrogen ion concentration of solution-2 is 10-11 mol/L, choose the correct option.
options: Solution-1 is more acidic than solution-3
Solution-1 is acidic and  solution-2 is basic
Solution-2 is more basic than solution-2
Solution-2 is more acidic than solution-2
